channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Israel says airstrike in Yemen will block weapons to Houthi militia
item.description: Israeli jets bombed Yemen's Red Sea port of Hodeidah, igniting huge fires and inflicting substantial damage. Israel says the port is where Houthi fighters received many of their weapons from Iran.
item.content:encoded:
Israeli jets bombed Yemen's Red Sea port of Hodeidah, igniting huge fires and inflicting substantial damage. Israel says the port is where Houthi fighters received many of their weapons from Iran.

(Image credit: AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: Southwest Airlines is facing a unique climate change problem: exploding soda cans
item.description: Extreme temperatures have caused problems for the beverage service on some Southwest Airlines flights, with hot cans exploding when opened.
item.content:encoded: Extreme temperatures have caused problems for the beverage service on some Southwest Airlines flights, with hot cans exploding when opened.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: At the funeral of a senior Hamas leader, pride and hope for the future
item.description: The war in Gaza has brought Sunni and Shiite armed groups closer together in Lebanon. Many there fear that fighting on its border with Israel could drag the country into war.
item.content:encoded: The war in Gaza has brought Sunni and Shiite armed groups closer together in Lebanon. Many there fear that fighting on its border with Israel could drag the country into war.
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: Vietnam's most senior political leader has died, leaving behind a vacuum in the party
item.description: What does the death of the long-serving leader of Vietnam, one of the world's last remaining communist regimes, mean for the country and the region?
item.content:encoded: What does the death of the long-serving leader of Vietnam, one of the world's last remaining communist regimes, mean for the country and the region?
item.dc:creator: Michael Sullivan

item.title: The Crowdstrike outage disrupted many industries. Hospitals were especially vulnerable
item.description: We look at how the CrowdStrike update, which caused a major comms outage for airlines and banks, affected hospitals.
item.content:encoded: We look at how the CrowdStrike update, which caused a major comms outage for airlines and banks, affected hospitals.
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin

item.title: A political analyst explains what's next for the presidential race
item.description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe talks with political pundit Charlie Sykes about his take on the state of the presidential race, now between conventions.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe talks with political pundit Charlie Sykes about his take on the state of the presidential race, now between conventions.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: J.D. Vance pledged to address addiction. Patients at a nearby clinic hope he's serious
item.description: Just a few miles away where the GOP vice presidential candidate J.D. Vance spoke at the convention in Milwaukee about the tragedy of addiction, people at a health clinic hope for more than promises.
item.content:encoded: Just a few miles away where the GOP vice presidential candidate J.D. Vance spoke at the convention in Milwaukee about the tragedy of addiction, people at a health clinic hope for more than promises.
item.dc:creator: Chuck Quirmbach

item.title: How to keep cool while saving energy (and money)
item.description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe speaks with Stefano Schiavon, a professor at University of California, Berkeley, on the benefits of using fans in conjunction with air conditioners.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe speaks with Stefano Schiavon, a professor at University of California, Berkeley, on the benefits of using fans in conjunction with air conditioners.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: Trump addresses his first rally since the assassination attempt
item.description: We look at former president Donald Trump's rally in Michigan - the first one since the assassination attempt on him and the first one with his new running mate, Ohio Sen. J.D. Vance.
item.content:encoded: We look at former president Donald Trump's rally in Michigan - the first one since the assassination attempt on him and the first one with his new running mate, Ohio Sen. J.D. Vance.
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: Women in Ukraine are taking over traditionally male-dominated work as the war goes on
item.description: A program in Ukraine trains women to drive buses and large trucks — jobs typically dominated by men. But the ongoing conflict with Russia is reshaping Ukraine's economy, its job market and who is available to work.
item.content:encoded: A program in Ukraine trains women to drive buses and large trucks — jobs typically dominated by men. But the ongoing conflict with Russia is reshaping Ukraine's economy, its job market and who is available to work.
item.dc:creator: Ashley Westerman
